Issues.Title: [release/3.0] Update dependencies from dotnet/core-setup
Issues.Body:
This pull request updates the following dependencies

## From https://github.com/dotnet/core-setup
- **Build**: 20190408.08
- **Date Produced**: 4/8/2019 11:55 PM
- **Commit**: 3f1e51332c9c7ac4d749659ca8fe4e961dafc298
- **Branch**: refs/heads/release/3.0
- **Updates**:
  - **Microsoft.NETCore.App** -> 3.0.0-preview4-27608-08

## Coherency Updates

The following updates ensure that dependencies with a *CoherentParentDependency*
attribute were produced in a build used as input to the parent dependency's build.
See [Dependency Description Format](https://github.com/dotnet/arcade/blob/master/Documentation/DependencyDescriptionFormat.md#dependency-description-overview)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[master] Update dependencies from dotnet/core-setup" (#707)

Issues.Title: Implement and cleanup System.Windows.Forms.Design event args
Issues.Body: Fixes #701
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Implement and cleanup System.Windows.Forms.Design event args" (#703)

Issues.Title: new ToolboxComponentsCreatedEventArgs(null).Components throws NRE should return null
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "new ToolboxComponentsCreatedEventArgs(null).Components throws NRE should return null" (#701)

Issues.Title: ToolboxItem.Version throws NRE for AssemblyName without a version
Issues.Body: Should return `string.Empty`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ToolboxItem.Version throws NRE for AssemblyName without a version" (#706)

Issues.Title: ToolboxItem.Properties for "DependentAssemblies" does not validate the value type like for the other properties
Issues.Body: Allows values, e.g. new object(), causing `InvalidCastException`s when used. Should just return throw `ArgumentException` when set like everything else
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ToolboxItem.Properties for "DependentAssemblies" does not validate the value type like for the other properties" (#705)

Issues.Title: Cleanup ScrollBar/ScrollProperties
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR " Cleanup ScrollBar/ScrollProperties" (#700)

Issues.Title: Cleanup MenuItem and add param names
Issues.Body: All this is already tested
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Cleanup MenuItem and add param names" (#699)

Issues.Title: There are now 3 copies of NativeMethods in winforms
Issues.Body: These should be able to be consolidated. I'll give this a punt when my outstanding PRs are merged
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "There are now 3 copies of NativeMethods in winforms" (#698)

Issues.Title: Fix buffer size passed to GetClipboardFormatName in DataFormats
Issues.Body:
Previously, the maximum buffer size for `GetClipboardFormatName` was 128, but now it is 256. This means that we'd chop off up to half of the string when retrieving strings longer than 128. Fix this by updating the buffer size

Also cleanup the code and add complete test coverage

Fixes #696
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix buffer size passed to GetClipboardFormatName in DataFormats" (#697)

Issues.Title: Buffer size passed to GetClipboardFormatName is too small for newer platforms
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Buffer size passed to GetClipboardFormatName is too small for newer platforms" (#696)

Issues.Title: Cleanup Form.IsRestrictedWindow
Issues.Body: `Form.IsRestrictedWindow` is always false in .NET Core because .NET Core doesn't implement permissions/CAS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Cleanup Form.IsRestrictedWindow" (#695)

Fixes #690

Issues.Title: ListControl.FilterItemOnProperty(new object(), null) throws NRE should be a nop
Issues.Body: To match string.Empty
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ListControl.FilterItemOnProperty(new object(), null) throws NRE should be a nop" (#690)

Issues.Title: Add Visual Basic dotnet new project template
Issues.Body:
Should match VB project template from Framework

* WinFormsApplication-VBasic
  * Company.WinFormsApplication1.vbproj
  * Form1.Desiger.vb
  * Form1.vb
  * App.config (?)
  * My Project directory
    * Application.Designer.vb
    * Application.myapp (?)
    * AssemblyInfo.vb (? pretty sure no)
    * Resources.Designer.vb (?)
    * Resources.resx (?)
    * Settings.Designer.vb (?)
    * Settings.settings (?)
  * (? missing) xlf directory

And we'll need to figure out the template.config for this
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add Visual Basic dotnet new project template" (#689)

Issues.Body:
fixes #679
